item.title: Stephanie add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anatole France
item.description: "Until one has loved an animal, a part of one's soul remains unawakened." -- Anatole France

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies, said Jojen. The man who never reads lives only one." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Books are a uniquely portable magic." -- Stephen King

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Only the very weak-minded refuse to be influenced by literature and poetry." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Emilie Buchwald
item.description: "Children are made readers on the laps of their parents." -- Emilie Buchwald

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Cher
item.description:
"Some guy said to me: Don't you think you're too old to sing rock n' roll?
I said: You'd better check with Mick Jagger." -- Cher

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "Before Elvis there was nothing." -- John Lennon

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Edith Wharton - One of the first founders of the ASPCA
item.description: "My little dogs ... heartbeats at my feet." -- Edith Wharton - One of the first founders of the ASPCA

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Clint Eastwood
item.description: "I tried being reasonable, but I didn't like it." -- Clint Eastwood

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Here’s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "You are speaking of my future lover. Be more respectful." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "If there were an international butt competition, Eric would win, hands down—or cheeks up." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Food that walked and talked, that was us. McPeople." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Coffe is the perfume of morning." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by W. Bruce Cameron
item.description: "You can usually tell that a man is good if he has a dog who loves him." -- W. Bruce Cameron

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "Accept what people offer. Drink their milkshakes. Take their love." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Mark Helprin
item.description: "The shelf was filled with books that were hard to read, that could devastate and remake one's soul, and that, when they were finished, had a kick like a mule." -- Mark Helprin

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Mark Helprin
item.description:
"Nothing is random, nor will anything ever be, whether a long string of perfectly blue days that begin and end in golden dimness, the most seemingly chaotic political acts, the rise of a great city, the crystalline structure of a gem that has never seen the light, the distributions of fortune, what time the milkman gets up, the position of the electron, or the occurrence of one astonishing frigid winter after another. Even electrons, supposedly the paragons of unpredictability, are tame and obsequious little creatures that rush around at the speed of light, going precisely where they are supposed to go. They make faint whistling sounds that when apprehended in varying combinations are as pleasant as the wind flying through a forest, and they do exactly as they are told. Of this, one is certain.
And yet, there is a wonderful anarchy, in that the milkman chooses when to arise, the rat picks the tunnel into which he will dive when the subway comes rushing down the track from Borough Hall, and the snowflake will fall as it will. How can this be? If nothing is random, and everything is predetermined, how can there be free will? The answer to that is simple. Nothing is predetermined, it is determined, or was determined, or will be determined. No matter, it all happened at once, in less than an instant, and time was invented because we cannot comprehend in one glance the enormous and detailed canvas that we have been given - so we track it, in linear fashion piece by piece. Time however can be easily overcome; not by chasing the light, but by standing back far enough to see it all at once. The universe is still and complete. Everything that ever was is; everything that ever will be is - and so on, in all possible combinations. Though in perceiving it we image that it is in motion, and unfinished, it is quite finished and quite astonishingly beautiful. In the end, or rather, as things really are, any event, no matter how small, is intimately and sensibly tied to all others. All rivers run full to the sea; those who are apart are brought together; the lost ones are redeemed; the dead come back to life; the perfectly blue days that have begun and ended in golden dimness continue, immobile and accessible; and, when all is perceived in such a way as to obviate time, justice becomes apparent not as something that will be, but something that is." -- Mark Helprin

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Just remember... life without me would be even more unbearable." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I was good and bad, but never wicked." -- Anne Rice
